text:
Eduardo Bauzá (16 November 1939 – 17 February 2019) was an Argentine politician. He was Minister of Health and Minister of the Interior under Carlos Menem presidency from 1989 to 1990, and was later the first Chief of the Cabinet of Ministers from 1995 to 1996.
He was member of the Senate from 5 June 1996 until 10 December 1999.
In 2004, Bauzá was diagnosed with the Alzheimer's disease. He died on 17 February 2019 in Buenos Aires from complications of the disease, aged 79.
